task: Concatenate all MF4 files in the folder C:\Users\ADMIN\Downloads\ev-data-pack-v10\ev-data-pack-v10\electric_cars\log_files\Tesla Model 3\LOG\3F78A21D\00000001 and save the concatenated MF4 file with the name Tesla_Model_3_3F78A21D.mf4 in the same folder path. Once you are in the folder, click on any file, press CTRL+A to select all files in the folder, and then click Open to load all files.

plan.reasoning: Activate the asammdf window so subsequent UI queries and clicks target the application.
Capture the current asammdf UI to locate the 'Mode' menu and other batch-processing controls (discover coordinates dynamically).
Open the 'Mode' menu to switch application mode (use coordinates from the previous State-Tool).
Refresh UI state to find the 'Batch processing' menu item exposed by the Mode menu.
Select 'Batch processing' mode to enable batch operations such as concatenate.
Capture the batch-processing view to locate the 'Add files' button or equivalent control.
Open the file selection dialog to add input MF4 files for the batch operation.
Capture the file open dialog UI to locate the address bar, file list, and 'Open' button (so we can navigate to the target folder and select files).
Focus the file dialog address bar so we can type or paste the full target folder path.
Navigate the file dialog to the exact folder containing the MF4 files by entering the full path and pressing Enter.
Refresh the dialog state after navigation to ensure the file list is visible and to obtain the file-list coordinates.
Click any file in the folder (focus the file list) so subsequent keyboard selection (Ctrl+A) will target the folder contents.
Select all files in the folder (user requested action to select all MF4 files before opening).
Capture the dialog state after selection to locate the 'Open' button (ensure it is enabled and discover coordinates).
Click 'Open' to load all selected files into the batch-processing queue in asammdf.
Refresh asammdf batch view to confirm files are loaded and to locate the operation selector (to choose 'Concatenate') and output filename controls.
Open the batch operation dropdown to select the 'Concatenate' operation.
Get the menu state to find the 'Concatenate' option exposed by the operation dropdown.
Select 'Concatenate' as the batch operation to combine all input MF4 files into one continuous measurement.
Locate the output filename / save path input control and the 'Start' or 'Save' button in the batch UI.
Focus the output filename/path input so we can enter the target output path and filename.
Ensure the output filename field is active and available for typing (refresh UI state before Type-Tool).
Enter the full output path and filename to save the concatenated MF4 in the same folder with the requested name.
Capture the UI one last time to locate the 'Start' or 'Save' button and confirm readiness to run the batch operation.
Start the concatenation job (or save the resulting MF4); use the discovered Start/Save button coordinates to begin processing.

Switch to Batch processing, add files from the specified folder via the file dialog, select all files (Ctrl+A) as requested, choose the Concatenate operation, set the full output path/name to Tesla_Model_3_3F78A21D.mf4 in the same folder, and start the job. State-Tool calls are used before each click/type to discover UI element coordinates dynamically and avoid hardcoding.
